719653f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Hester Street
719653f-a.text:
Essex Street, east side, north from and including Hester Street.
March 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719653f-a.folder: Essex Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY

720409f-a.title: Manhattan: Hester Street - Essex Street
720409f-a.text:
Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets. Note
the flag of P.S. No. 75 (Norfolk Street, west side, north of Hester) across
the roofs. To-day (1937) this has been replaced by P.S. No. 62, which also
occupies the sites of buildings in the foreground. No. 41 Hester Street,
is a 3-story frame house with a brick front.
About 1905.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720409f-a.folder: Hester Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

720408f-a.title: Manhattan: Hester Street - Essex Street
720408f-a.text:
(1)
Rester Street, (running from fore to background), east from Essex, to
Clinton Streets, showing (right), a portion of Seward Park and (left), the
playground pf P.S. No. 62. Also shown are Nos. 18 to 30 Norfolk Street, at
adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of Hester Street. The 2-story
building at the corner, is the Hester Street branch of the N.Y. Edison Co.
April 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, another angle.
About 1936
Gift of Dr. Michael aishengrad A.R.P.S.
CREDIT LINE I.PERATIVE Ol ALL REPRODUCTIOL.S.

720410f-a.title: Manhattan: Hester Street - Essex Street
720410f-a.text:
Hester Street, north side, east from Essex to Suffolk Streets.
Note No. 41; a 3-story frame house with a brick front. Buildings between
Essex and Norfolk Streets, have been replaced by P.S. No. 62.
About 1905.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720412f-a.title: Manhattan: Hester Street - Essex Street
720412f-a.text:
44-48 Hester Street, south side, between Essex and Pudlow Streets.
Nos. 46-48 Hester Street, are 3-story frame buildings with brick
fronts.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies, Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 556.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPPOOUCTIONS.
720412f-a.folder: Hester Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

719649f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Hester Street
719649f-a.text:
31 to 1 Essex Street, west side, from north of Hester to and
including Canal Streets. The view also shows 2-16 Rutgers Street,
west side, from Canal to Henry Streets. The St. Teresa Roman
Catholic Church is in the background in Henry Street. The view also
shows 163-175 East Broadway, at, adjoinAng and east of the S.E. cor-
ner of Rutgers Street.
April so, 1931.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719649f-a.folder: Essex Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
